intro: Moraea unguiculata, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are borne on tall, erect stems and are often used in gardens for their ornamental value. Moraea unguiculata is adapted to Mediterranean climates and prefers well-drained soils.
